title: Ticket #6172: daemoncore doesn't set the correct return value when IPVerify fails
description:
In the case where HTCondor is resuming a session, and it comes from an IP address that is not authorized (or in the DENY list), daemoncore fails to close the connection after IPVerify fails and instead continues on with the command handler. This has two implications:

1) In the 8.4.X series, and 8.5.0, when using MATCH_PASSWORD, because the security code didn't automatically punch a hole in the authorization rules, this results in a spurious "PERMISSION DENIED" error in the logs when in fact it should succeed (and 8.5.1 and later, does so without the message).

2) If an administrator adds an IP addres to the DENY_DAEMON or DENY_WRITE list, they need to restart (and not just reconfig) the running daemons.
